93ae22ee-6761-4978-9a35-0ce9dcd3fd7c.description: Earners of the AACRAO International Credential Evaluation: The Foundations badge have developed the fundamental skill sets to evaluate foreign academic credentials for undergraduate and graduate admissions. Recipients are competent in applying standard industry best practices and a systematic approach to the evaluation of credentials, contrasting educational models, national systems, and international educational credentials.
93ae22ee-6761-4978-9a35-0ce9dcd3fd7c.name: AACRAO International Credential Evaluation: The Foundations

issuer.summary: issued by American Association of Collegiate Registrars and Admissions Officers

entity.name: American Association of Collegiate Registrars and Admissions Officers

badge_template_activities.title: Individuals who earned this badge completed the self-paced course, utilizing authentic records and real-life scenarios to make appropriate admissions recommendations.
Individuals who earned this badge completed the course and passed the final assessment with a minimum of 70%.

f86662b3-3870-4324-bf0d-d883aa4d1024.description: Earners of the AACRAO Federal Compliance fundamentals badge have developed the foundational understanding of federal statutory and regulatory requirements that often fall under the purview of the registrar, admissions, or enrollment services offices on campus. Recipients are versed in their institution’s obligations in regulations throughout seven content areas: FERPA Basics, GDPR vs FERPA, Solomon Amendment, Clery Act, Voter Registration, Constitution Day, and Decennial Census.
f86662b3-3870-4324-bf0d-d883aa4d1024.name: Federal Compliance

issuer.summary: issued by American Association of Collegiate Registrars and Admissions Officers

entity.name: American Association of Collegiate Registrars and Admissions Officers

alignments.name: Recordkeeping Compliance
alignments.description: Strong working knowledge of state, federal, accreditation and institutional student records compliance mandates and proven leadership, the training of staff, faculty, and administrators. Demonstrated professional achievement working with student records and academic policy enforcement.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete all seven courses in the AACRAO Compliance Corner suite:  FERPA Basics, GDPR vs FERPA, Solomon Amendment, Clery Act, Voter Registration, Constitution Day, and Decennial Census.
Pass the final assessment based on all seven courses in the AACRAO Compliance Corner with 70% or higher.

03117098-05e5-4262-b53f-a005a8cebe11.description: Earners of the AACRAO International Series: India fundamentals badge have developed the fundamental skill sets to evaluate academic credentials from India for freshman and graduate admission. Recipients are competent in applying best industry practices to determine the recognition status of H.E.I.s, authenticity of records, grade conversion and credential recommendations.
03117098-05e5-4262-b53f-a005a8cebe11.name: AACRAO International Series: India

issuer.summary: issued by American Association of Collegiate Registrars and Admissions Officers

entity.name: American Association of Collegiate Registrars and Admissions Officers

badge_template_activities.title: Individuals who earned this badge completed the self-paced course, utilizing authentic records and real-life scenarios to make appropriate admissions recommendations.

675dfedb-a8cc-45f9-9f4b-98feaa624b68.description: Earners of the AACRAO Federal Process and Advocacy badge have developed a fundamental understanding of the federal legislative process, including how a bill becomes a law and the federal budget process. Earners have the basic skill sets to set-up meetings with Congressional representatives, to prepare for these meetings and know what to expect during these meetings. In addition, earners have the tools to engage with both state and federal issues while being in federal compliance.
675dfedb-a8cc-45f9-9f4b-98feaa624b68.name: Federal Process and Advocacy

issuer.summary: issued by American Association of Collegiate Registrars and Admissions Officers

entity.name: American Association of Collegiate Registrars and Admissions Officers

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of the badge completed all the modules in the self-paced course. The modules include the legislative process, federal budget process, lobbying vs. advocacy, congressional meetings, and how to set up congressional meetings.
Pass the final assessment based on all seven courses in the AACRAO Federal Process and Advocacy 101 course with 70% or higher.

3ab6d15e-64c0-4e9d-8010-a80c69c6d83d.description: Earners of the International Credential Evaluation: Transfer Credit fundamentals badge have developed the fundamental skill sets to evaluate foreign academic credentials for potential transfer credit. Recipients are competent in utilizing best industry practices to determine appropriate transfer credit from short-term and incomplete university programs, as well as study abroad programs.
3ab6d15e-64c0-4e9d-8010-a80c69c6d83d.name: International Credential Evaluation: Transfer Credit

0fc5aa97-05a6-4feb-9cb5-01ee9e177020.description: Earners of the AACRAO History and Progress: 400 Years of American Higher Education badge have developed a fundamental understanding of the historical foundation of American higher education throughout four content areas: important legal cases, significant “firsts”, higher education trailblazers and important historical events from1970-2020. Recipients are versed in historical “firsts” and how these impact current ideas, processes, and policies in strategic enrollment management (SEM) and beyond.
0fc5aa97-05a6-4feb-9cb5-01ee9e177020.name: History and Progress: 400 Years of American Higher Education

issuer.summary: issued by American Association of Collegiate Registrars and Admissions Officers

entity.name: American Association of Collegiate Registrars and Admissions Officers

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of the badge completed all the modules in the the self-paced course. The modules include significant "firsts", who's who, U.S. Supreme Court rulings and legislation, and recent history from 1970-2020.
Pass the final assessment based on all seven courses in the AACRAO Compliance Corner with 70% or higher.

57387878-d333-4864-a194-cad638dc16f6.description: Earners of the AACRAO SEM Endorsement have developed competencies needed to effectively understand and practice the complexities involved in strategic enrollment management (SEM) operations on college campuses.
57387878-d333-4864-a194-cad638dc16f6.name: Strategic Enrollment Management Endorsement

issuer.summary: issued by American Association of Collegiate Registrars and Admissions Officers

entity.name: American Association of Collegiate Registrars and Admissions Officers

alignments.name: SEM Assessment
alignments.description: Working collaboratively with appropriate institutional partners, develop, articulate and implement a comprehensive, data-driven process to assess progress towards the institution’s enrollment management plan. Assess the staffing, policy, process, reporting and cultural environment of the institution determining gaps in current SEM plans.

alignments.name: SEM Leadership
alignments.description: Develop, articulate and implement a comprehensive, data-driven strategic enrollment management plan, that includes a focus on both recruitment and retention, aligns with the institution’s strategic initiatives and ensures a strong link between student need, institution-wide priorities, and financial planning.

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of a capstone project related to SEM. Involves original research.
Completion of three field visits and written reports.
Completion of the Essentials of SEM Online course.
View three webinars and submit a written report.

Earners apply best practices to evaluate authentic international educational records to determine admissibility at their institutions.

Earners of the badge completed all the self-paced modules assigned in the course. Each self-paced module contains an assessment that earners of the badge passed at 70% or higher. A content specific badge is issued upon passing each self-paced module.

These fundamentals include primary functions like degree audit, and key responsibilities in legal and compliance in various offices.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of the badge completed all the modules in the self-paced course. The modules include the history and background of the profession, primary functions including registration, degree audit, graduation, commencement, academic policy and technology, and legal and compliance areas including financial aid office, bursar’s office, accreditation and regulations.

104af9ce-48b0-4eb1-af5d-585bd535b4a0.description: Earners of the AACRAO State and Regional Fundamentals badge have developed a core understanding of the functions of a state and regional Association of Collegiate Registrars and Admissions Officers (ACRAO). Earners are able to apply best practices in managing an association, running meetings, and providing professional development activities for their members that are based on successful state and regional ACRAOs.
104af9ce-48b0-4eb1-af5d-585bd535b4a0.name: AACRAO State and Regional Fundamentals

issuer.summary: issued by American Association of Collegiate Registrars and Admissions Officers

entity.name: American Association of Collegiate Registrars and Admissions Officers

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of the badge completed all the modules in the self-paced course. The modules include organizational structure, association activities, leadership development, administrative practices, conference planning, and legal and financial considerations.
Individuals who earned this badge completed the course and passed the final assessment with a minimum of 70%.

d300818b-fc31-4bd8-9635-f0a179f4540c.description: The Baden-Württemberg Seminar focuses on the German educational system, German-American academic comparability, and student exchange between Germany and the U.S. The seminar provides visits to institutions in the state of Baden-Württemberg (BW), and gives participants the opportunity to connect with representatives from the wide variety of institutions in the BW higher education landscape. Seminar participants will also get updates about future BW seminars.
d300818b-fc31-4bd8-9635-f0a179f4540c.name: Baden-Württemberg Seminar

issuer.summary: issued by American Association of Collegiate Registrars and Admissions Officers

entity.name: American Association of Collegiate Registrars and Admissions Officers

badge_template_activities.title: Earners complete a cross-cultural seminar experience, learn about, and encounter the education system of Germany.
Earners interact with representatives from the Ministry of Science, Research, and Arts and representatives from institutions in the German education system.

cf751a3c-3569-4f98-b5e2-53a70698c081.description: Earners of the AACRAO Enrollment Managers' Role in Retention and Student Success badge have developed a fundamental understanding of the EM's role in supporting retention and student success. Earners are able to apply and utilize the history, tools, data, and campus partners to successfully engage in and lead student success initiatives at a university of college.
cf751a3c-3569-4f98-b5e2-53a70698c081.name: Enrollment Managers' Role in Retention and Student Success

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of the badge completed all the modules in the self-paced course. The modules include definite success and the student lifecycle, how the departments of admissions, the registrar and financial aid play a role in student success, the role of data and technology and equity.
Pass the final assessment based on all modules in the AACRAO Enrollment Managers' Role in Retention and Student Success course with 70% or higher.

3af38d31-da9c-4ef5-89ab-37bf76337f6a.description: Earners of the Transfer Articulation 101 badge have developed a fundamental understanding of the principles for transfer, including guiding principles, articulation agreements/partnerships, and awareness for CPL/PLA. Although transfer practices vary by institution, earners are able to utilize basic concepts for varying institutional practices and policies and have the baseline competencies to comprehend policies and procedures for transfer operations at most higher education institutions.
3af38d31-da9c-4ef5-89ab-37bf76337f6a.name: Transfer Articulation 101

issuer.summary: issued by American Association of Collegiate Registrars and Admissions Officers

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of the badge completed all the modules in the self-paced course. The modules include guiding principles, transfer credit basics, common questions and considerations in the transfer office, articulation agreements, and credit for CPL/PLA.
Pass the final assessment based on all seven courses in the AACRAO Transfer Articulation 101 course with 70% or higher.

a6a0ef9a-91f0-4a7a-82b2-298f59f8976b.description: Earners of the AACRAO Enrollment Management: Environmental Scanning badge have developed a fundamental understanding of Environmental Scanning within a Strategic Enrollment Management (SEM) framework, and how it is used by institutions as guidance for decisions about the institution’s enrollment future. Earners can determine the what, why, who, when and how in an environmental scan, and utilizing tools like the Four Approaches to determine the most effective approach at their institution.
a6a0ef9a-91f0-4a7a-82b2-298f59f8976b.name: AACRAO Enrollment Management: Environmental Scanning

issuer.summary: issued by American Association of Collegiate Registrars and Admissions Officers

Pass the final assessment based on all seven courses in the AACRAO Enrollment Management: Environmental Scanning course with 70% or higher.

e9db00f9-b783-4f7e-b6cd-373d33751e8a.description: Earners of the AACRAO Managing Leading and Admissions Office badge have developed a comprehensive understanding of the roles and responsibilities of a chief admissions officer (CAO), or other leadership position. Earners are able to understand and apply best practices including how to utilize partnerships and resources and the core skills and competencies necessary to be successful managing and leading an admissions office.
e9db00f9-b783-4f7e-b6cd-373d33751e8a.name: Managing and Leading an Admissions Office

issuer.summary: issued by American Association of Collegiate Registrars and Admissions Officers

Individuals who earned this badge completed the course and passed the final assessment with a minimum of 70%.

676f0948-58d0-4eae-b943-2d8a9e2b2aee.description: Earners of the AACRAO Core Concepts of Strategic Enrollment Management (SEM) badge have developed a fundamental understanding of a SEM framework, and how it is used by enrollment managers as guidance for decisions about the institution’s enrollment future. Earners can apply concepts that support student success from recruitment and marketing to degree award and goal attainment.

3396e0ab-e361-4a5b-a430-fef00062a062.description: Earners of the Change Management badge have developed the skills to identify the need for implementing a change within the organization based on data analysis and environmental scans, define the scope of the change, and provide the leadership required to execute the change. badge_template_activities.title: Earners of the badge completed all the modules in the self-paced course. The modules include the theoretical foundations, transitions, theory to practice, bumpy roads and ethical change management.
Individuals who earned this badge completed the course and passed the final assessment with a minimum of 70%.

7ddae497-148b-49d3-ba7c-ac6e1548bbab.description: Earners of the Effective Admissions Recruitment badge have developed an understanding of fundamentals of effective admissions recruitment, utilizing such concepts as the stages of recruitment, developing the applicant pool, converting the applicant pool, and the role of financial aid. Earners are able to utilize the history, data and strategies that can then be leveraged in developing Admissions Tactical Recruitment Plan (ATRP).
7ddae497-148b-49d3-ba7c-ac6e1548bbab.name: Effective Admissions Recruitment: Admissions 101

issuer.summary: issued by American Association of Collegiate Registrars and Admissions Officers

entity.name: American Association of Collegiate Registrars and Admissions Officers

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of the badge completed all the modules in the self-paced course. The modules include the different types of Funnels, important steps in sales, how data drives decisions and customer service and the art of persuasion.
Pass the final assessment based on all seven courses in the AACRAO Effective Admissions Recruitment course with 70% or higher.

c46b46d7-2ffe-476e-abb8-de927114786a.description: AACRAO’s ASCEND program, an intensive professional development program for mid-career enrollment leaders, accelerates the ability of participants to consider complex enrollment problems, lead change management, use data to inform strategies, and lead long-range Strategic Enrollment Planning (SEM) work. The one-year program requires that participants complete multiple online modules and assignments. Participants are also required to receive programs and career coaching from a veteran SEM leader.
c46b46d7-2ffe-476e-abb8-de927114786a.name: AACRAO ASCEND Enrollment Management Leader

issuer.summary: issued by American Association of Collegiate Registrars and Admissions Officers

entity.name: American Association of Collegiate Registrars and Admissions Officers

alignments.name: Leadership and Management
alignments.description: Ability to identify the functions and business processes necessary to operate an office, develop an operating budget, and build a professional staff to conduct the activities of the office. Ability to identify utilization and operationalize customer and student services best practices.

alignments.name: Diversity and Inclusion
alignments.description: Admissions, registrar, and enrollment management professionals value and foster an environment that ensures respect, support and safety for all members of their campus and professional communities, and actively promote the expansion of ideas, perspectives, and understanding that comes from a diverse and inclusive community.

alignments.name: Interpretation and Application of Institutional and External Data
alignments.description: Understanding of Institutional and External data in the context of what impact the data has on the Strategic Enrollment goals of the institution. To be able to interpret and apply the data for the purposes of short-term and long-term Strategic Enrollment goals of the institution and to monitor short-term operations.

badge_template_activities.title: Collaboration and Consensus Building: understand and assess the looming enrollment crisis and be able to articulate a path forward; understand consensus and collaboration building; assess institutional culture and its ability to improve; match planning and decision making models to that build collaboration and consensus in the institution's unique context; utilize framing to better understand problems; understand Shared Governance and its importance in the Enrollment Management Process.

Change Management: Understand the role managers have in change process; learn tools/strategies to assess current environments (what is the problem? what change is needed and why?); acquire a set of tools/frameworks to become an effective change leader/problem solver; gain tools on how to sustain change

Data Analysis and Leveraging Technology in Higher Education: explain and articulate future demographic shifts and potential threats to enrollment numbers; analyze basic data sets that are relevant to enrollment management; develop and clearly understand enrollment projection models; enhance the understanding of administrative assessment planning practices; develop a plan for their areas of leadership; discuss and highlight how to integrate and maximize usage of CRM’s and other data systems.

Enrollment Management - The Return: understand the need to inspire transformational change; develop skills needed as the campus key enrollment strategist; develop leadership skills to oversee large, dynamic units; create coalitions and partnerships with key campus stakeholders; develop senior campus leadership team skills; articulate the benefits of the EM role; discuss effective EM leadership impact; develop a personal plan for EM leadership that tracks skill development and acquisition.

Capstone Project: Strategic Enrollment Management (SEM) Plan.  Use their institutional data or provided data from a hypothetical case to:  Determine SEM plan scope, length; align to institutional mission/vision; build a case for change and action with external trend and internal enrollment pattern evidence; develop data-informed, focused enrollment goals; create bold strategies that set the direction to meet enrollment goals; develop tactics that operationalize strategies.

dc3769a9-9d31-4c66-85a9-aca02dec852e.description: Earners of the AACRAO Financial Aid in the Registrar’s Office badge have developed an expanded understanding of the Financial Aid Office and how it relates specifically to the Registrar’s Office and the importance of the relationship between Financial Aid and the Registrar. Earners are able to understand and apply best practices on how to approach policy development, Clearinghouse reporting, as well as the audit process.
dc3769a9-9d31-4c66-85a9-aca02dec852e.name: Financial Aid in the Registrar’s Office

issuer.summary: issued by American Association of Collegiate Registrars and Admissions Officers

entity.name: American Association of Collegiate Registrars and Admissions Officers

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of the badge completed all the modules in the self-paced course. The modules include the history of financial aid, common programs and compliance rules, working together, intersection between offices of the registrar and financial aid, progress towards degree and SAP, Clearinghouse reporting and the audit process.
Individuals who earned this badge completed the course and passed the final assessment with a minimum of 70%.

150d692c-0e2b-4fa4-941b-3d35435a765f.description: Earners of the AACRAO Holistic/Equity Approach to Admissions badge have a comprehensive understanding of why and how to include nonacademic factors, like noncognitive variables, within the admissions process. Earners understand what noncognitive variables are, and the legal precedent that supports the use of nonacademic measures as well has how to implement this methodology at their institutions.
150d692c-0e2b-4fa4-941b-3d35435a765f.name: Holistic/Equitable Approach to Admissions

issuer.summary: issued by American Association of Collegiate Registrars and Admissions Officers

entity.name: American Association of Collegiate Registrars and Admissions Officers

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of the badge completed all the modules in the self-paced course. The modules include the definitions of terms, a new look at assessment, what are noncognitive variables, the legal precedent for using the, and the application and implementation of noncognitive variables as well as four case studies.
Individuals who earned this badge completed the course and passed the final assessment with a minimum of 70%.
